task.title: Troubleshoot Weak or No Sound Coming from the Circuit
task.shortdesc: Follow each problem-solution in order to rule out each one.

context.p: If your guitar circuit produces weak or no sound, work through each potential cause in the order listed below until the problem is resolved.

step.cmd: Test for faulty humbucker or output jack.
If the problem persists, check for miswired connections.
If the problem persists, check for cold solder joints.
If the problem persists, check for shorts between hot and ground.
If the problem persists, verify the pickup is properly grounded and connected.
If none of the previous steps resolve the problem, replace the damaged potentiometer.

result.p: By systematically working through these troubleshooting steps, you will identify and resolve the cause of weak or no sound in your guitar circuit.
